  • Yellow Bird and Tortoise October 15, 2014

    Once, there was a yellow bird who lived in a small pet store in Greenwich Village. Like all the animals in the store, he longed for a human to take him home. After all, there was something different about being taken care of by an owner rather than Petco staff; the bird, like all the other animals, longed for human love.

  • Anna Coit, North Stonington's grande dame, dies at age 106 October 15, 2014

    Summary of article originally published in The Day. View full.

    Anna North Coit, prolific poet, founding member of the North Stonington Historical Society and a role model to friends of many ages, died Wednesday morning at Apple Rehab in Mystic. She was 106.

  • From candy corn to the Holocaust Ledyard's history electives popular September 12, 2014

    Summary of article originally published in The Day. View full.

    An enthusiastic team of teachers - three for each subject - got creative when designing the new curriculum. While students in one class prepared for a semester of war crime case studies by reading the Geneva Convention's definition of genocide, the kids in the pop culture class were trying to guess which decade gave birth to (or brought popularity to) certain types of candy.

  • North Stonington town, school boards divided over project that failed at vote September 11, 2014

    Summary of article originally published in The Day. View full.

    Board of Finance Chairman Dan Spring drew on his experience as a pilot on Tuesday to explain to a room of school and town officials why they should not be deterred from continuing work on the school project that has failed at referendum twice.

    Passengers may be relaxing on a cross-country flight on a 747, but the pilot "is continually making corrections on that aircraft to get it from JFK to Los Angeles. Continually," he...
